original: @328a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @328a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya t'a r'a s'a dha nam /
analyzed: a'arya t'a r'a s'a dha nam /
translated: Āryatārāsādhana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags ma sgrol ma sgrub pa'i thabs /
analyzed: 'phags ma sgrol ma sgrub pa'i thabs /
translated: The Means of Attaining Ārya Tārā

original: dang po re zhig sngags pas kha la sogs pa dag par byas nas /
analyzed: dang po re zhig sngags pas kha la sogs pa dag par byas nas /
translated: First, a mantra practitioner, having purified mouth and so forth,

original: sa phyogs dben par 'dug ste /
analyzed: sa phyogs dben par 'dug ste /
translated: sits in an isolated place,

original: byang chub mchog @328b tu sems bskyed la /
analyzed: byang chub mchog @328b tu sems bskyed la /
translated: generates the mind of supreme awakening,

original: rang gi snying gar aa las byung ba'i zla ba'i steng du yi ge t'am ljang gu 'od zer dang ldan par bsams nas /
analyzed: rang gi snying gar aa las byung ba'i zla ba'i steng du yi ge t'am ljang gu 'od zer dang ldan par bsams nas /
translated: and imagines on a moon arisen from A in one's heart a green tāṃ radiating light rays.

original: de'i 'od zer gyis ma rig pa'i mun pa bsal nas khams gsum du spros te /
analyzed: de'i 'od zer gyis ma rig pa'i mun pa bsal nas khams gsum du spros te /
translated: Those light rays dispel the darkness of ignorance, spread throughout the three realms,

original: 'gro ba'i don byas nas phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa'i sgrol ma spyan drangs te ;
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don byas nas phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa'i sgrol ma spyan drangs te ;
translated: perform the welfare of living beings, and invite Tārā residing in the ten directions.

original: mdun du bltas la /
analyzed: mdun du bltas la /
translated: Looking in front,

original: phyag dang / mchod pa dang / sdig pa bshags pa dang / gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang / bskul ma gdab pa dang / mya ngan las mi 'da' bar gsol ba gdab pa zhes bya ba bla na med pa'i yan lag bdun pa'i mchod pa byas nas byams pa la sogs pa tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag dang / mchod pa dang / sdig pa bshags pa dang / gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang / bskul ma gdab pa dang / mya ngan las mi 'da' bar gsol ba gdab pa zhes bya ba bla na med pa'i yan lag bdun pa'i mchod pa byas nas byams pa la sogs pa tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, having performed the unsurpassable seven-limbed worship, which is called prostration, offering, confession of sins, going for refuge to the Three Jewels, rejoicing in merit, requesting [the buddhas] to teach, and beseeching [the buddhas] not to pass into nirvāṇa, one should cultivate the four divine abodes of love and so forth.

original: de nas aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko&amp ;
analyzed: de nas aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko&amp ;
translated: Then, reciting the consecration mantra, “Oṃ śūnyatā-jñāna-vajra-svabhāvātmako ’haṃ,”

original: ham / zhes bya ba'i byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags brjod cing thams cad stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ham / zhes bya ba'i byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags brjod cing thams cad stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: one should meditate on everything as emptiness.

original: de nas padma dang zla ba'i steng du t'am yongs su gyur pa las /
analyzed: de nas padma dang zla ba'i steng du t'am yongs su gyur pa las /
translated: Then, on a lotus and moon, one should visualize a tāṃ syllable,

original: autpal sngon po t'am gis mtshan pa bsam de rnams yongs su gyur pa las /
analyzed: autpal sngon po t'am gis mtshan pa bsam de rnams yongs su gyur pa las /
translated: which transforms into a blue utpala marked with tāṃ.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma sgrol ma zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma sgrol ma zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma /
translated: From those [syllables], one should visualize Bhagavatī Tārā, with one face and two arms,

original: sku mdog ljang gu lang tsho dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sku mdog ljang gu lang tsho dang ldan pa /
translated: One should meditate on oneself as the color of green, youthful,

original: stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs dang ldan pa /
analyzed: stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs dang ldan pa /
translated: wearing an upper and lower garment,

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: adorned with all ornaments,

original: g-yas mchog sbyin dang / g-yon gyis autpal bsnams pa padma dang zla ba'i steng du g-yon bskum pa'i phyed skyil gyis bzhugs par bdag nyid bsgoms la /
analyzed: g-yas mchog sbyin dang / g-yon gyis autpal bsnams pa padma dang zla ba'i steng du g-yon bskum pa'i phyed skyil gyis bzhugs par bdag nyid bsgoms la /
translated: giving the boon-granting gesture with the right hand and holding an utpala flower with the left hand, standing on a lotus and moon, in the ardhaparyaṅka posture with the left leg extended.

original: de'i thugs ka'i zla ba la dam tshig sems ma ji lta ba'i ye shes sems ma dang / de'i thugs ka'i zla ba la yi ge t'am ting nge 'dzin sems ma'i tshul du bsam /
analyzed: de'i thugs ka'i zla ba la dam tshig sems ma ji lta ba'i ye shes sems ma dang / de'i thugs ka'i zla ba la yi ge t'am ting nge 'dzin sems ma'i tshul du bsam /
translated: On the moon at the heart of the pledge-being is the gnosis-being similar to oneself, and on the moon at the heart of that is the syllable taṃ, or the meditation-being in the aspect of a tāṃ.

original: de'i 'od zer gyis ye shes sems ma spyan drangs pa la sogs pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / bdud rtsi lhag mas don yod grub pas spyi gtsug tu rgyas btab ste /
analyzed: de'i 'od zer gyis ye shes sems ma spyan drangs pa la sogs pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / bdud rtsi lhag mas don yod grub pas spyi gtsug tu rgyas btab ste /
translated: One should meditate on the invocation of the gnosis-being with light rays, and so on, the conferral of empowerment, and the consecration by Amoghasiddhi with the remaining elixir.

original: 'od zer 'phros 'dus 'gro ba'i don mdzad par mi skyo'i bar du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'od zer 'phros 'dus 'gro ba'i don mdzad par mi skyo'i bar du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate until one is tired of emanating and gathering light rays that accomplish the welfare of living beings.

original: skyo na sngags bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: skyo na sngags bzlas par bya ste /
translated: When one is tired of that, one should recite the mantra.

original: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ tāre tuttāre ture svāhā.

original: zhes bya ba 'bum phrag bcu bzlas nas stong phrag bcus sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'bum phrag bcu bzlas nas stong phrag bcus sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Recite this ten million times, and then perform ten thousand burnt offerings.

original: 'gyur ba med par pha rol la //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med par pha rol la //
translated: To the unchanging,

original: mi zad dga' bas bdud rtsi'i ros //
analyzed: mi zad dga' bas bdud rtsi'i ros //
translated: To the nectar of inexhaustible joy,

original: srid pa'i sdug bsngal 'joms mdzad ma //
analyzed: srid pa'i sdug bsngal 'joms mdzad ma //
translated: To the one who conquers the suffering of existence,

original: sgrol ma khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //🔽zhes bya @329a * //
analyzed: sgrol ma khyod la phyag 'tshal lo // zhes bya @329a * //
translated: I pay homage to you, Tārā.

original: bas bzlas pa'i rjes la bstod nas /
analyzed: bas bzlas pa'i rjes la bstod nas /
translated: Having praised with this at the end of the recitation,

original: yi ge brgya pa brjod de bsod nams bsngos la /
analyzed: yi ge brgya pa brjod de bsod nams bsngos la /
translated: recite the hundred-syllable mantra and dedicate the merit.

original: aom badzra mu:zhes pas gshegs su gsol /
analyzed: aom badzra mu:zhes pas gshegs su gsol /
translated: With Oṃ vajra muḥ, request departure.

original: aom aa k'a ro mu kham sarbadharm'a n'am a'a dya nutpanna tv'ata /
analyzed: aom aa k'a ro mu kham sarbadharm'a n'am a'a dya nutpanna tv'ata /
translated: Oṃ āḥ kāra mukham sarva dharmāṇām ādyanutpannatva āt.

original: aom a'a:h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes bya bas gtor ma'i sngags so //
analyzed: aom a'a:h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes bya bas gtor ma'i sngags so //
translated: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā. This is the mantra for the bali offering.

original: zla ba drug gi bar du zhag re re zhing thun gsum du 'di dag bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba drug gi bar du zhag re re zhing thun gsum du 'di dag bya'o //
translated: Do this every day for six months, three times a day.

original: bla ma chen po sh'akya shr'i gha dras mdzad pa rje btsun sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: bla ma chen po sh'akya shr'i gha dras mdzad pa rje btsun sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
translated: The sādhana of Venerable Tārā composed by the great guru Śākyaśrī Ghadhara is complete.

original: // / rgya gar shar phyogs dz'a ga ta la'i pandi ta chen po bi bh'u ti tsandra sa rang 'gyur du mdzad pa'o//
analyzed: // / rgya gar shar phyogs dz'a ga ta la'i pandi ta chen po bi bh'u ti tsandra sa rang 'gyur du mdzad pa'o//
translated: The great Indian pandit of the east, Vibhutichandra, translated this himself.
